tier_1_determinative.person_voluntarily_causes_hurt: Yes, the accused allegedly assaulted the complainant with a chain and stones.
tier_1_determinative.in_committing_or_attempting_robbery: Yes, the incident involved the loss of Rs.1500/- from the complainant during the assault.

tier_2_material.injury_severity: The complainant suffered injuries on his back, head, and limbs. The severity is not specified as grievous or simple in the document.

tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The incident allegedly occurred at 11:45 p.m. on an unspecified date.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: The State of Maharashtra vs. Bhika Rambhau Ekaankar & Others
tier_4_procedural.court_name: High Court of Judicature at Bombay
tier_4_procedural.respondent: Bhika Rambhau Ekaankar, Pradip Pralhad Jadhav, Rajesh Sudam Jadhav, Dattatraya Saadu Bagul
tier_4_procedural.counsel_for_appellant: Ms. Anamika Malhotra, APP for appellant-State
tier_4_procedural.acts_and_sections: Indian Penal Code Sections 341, 324, 394 read with 34

residual_details.additional_facts: The case involved previous enmity between the complainant and accused no.4. There were civil proceedings and several complaints filed between the parties. The trial court acquitted the accused, citing lack of evidence and contradictions in witness testimonies.

template_label: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery (IPC 394)
